00023 //Returns true if the output stream is already open
00024 bool LocalDataOutputStream::isOpen() {
00025 
00026         //If there is a fileOutputStream
00027         if (m_fileOutputStream != 0) {
00028                 //return true, the stream is open
00029                 return true;

00034         return false;

00037 //Attempt to open a output stream for the dataoutputstream class
00038 bool LocalDataOutputStream::open(bool textMode) {
00039 
00040         //If the file path is empty return false
00041         if (m_filePath.length() == 0) {
00042                 return false;
00043         }
00044 
00045         //if the stream is already open return false
00046         if (isOpen() == true) {
00047                 return false;
00048         }
00049 
00050         //Attempt to open the file
00051         if (textMode == true) {
00052 
00053                 printf("Opening in text mode\n");
00054 
00055                 m_fileOutputStream = fopen(m_filePath.c_str(), "w");
00056 
00057         } else {
00058                 printf("Open in binary write mode\n");
00059 
00060                 m_fileOutputStream = fopen(m_filePath.c_str(), "wb");
00061 
00062         }
00063 
00064         //If the open was good then return true
00065         if (m_fileOutputStream != 0)
00066                 return true;
00067 
00068         //Otherwise return false
00069         return false;
00070 }

00072 void LocalDataOutputStream::close() {
00073 
00074         if (isOpen() == true) {
00075 
00076                 fclose(m_fileOutputStream);
00077                 m_fileOutputStream = 0;
00078 
00079         }
00080 
00081 }

00084 bool LocalDataOutputStream::write(const void* Data, unsigned long size) {
00085 
00086         if (isOpen() == true) {
00087 
00088                 if (fwrite(Data, size, 1, m_fileOutputStream) != 1) {

00090                 }

00092                 return true;

00095 
00096                 return false;

00102 void LocalDataOutputStream::flush() {
00103
